botanical_details.potentially_harmful: May cause mild stomach upset if eaten, sap may cause skin irritation. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Mandevilla can be woody climbers or perennials, often with tuberous roots, and twining stems bearing simple leaves and axillary racemes of showy, funnel-shaped flowers with 5 spreading lobes

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in a temperate or warm greenhouse or conservatory in loam-based compost in full light but with shade from hot sun. Young plants can be grown in pots to stand outside in summer. Usually evergreen, but will drop leaves if too cold in winter
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed sown with heat in spring, or root softwood cuttings in late spring or semi-ripe cuttings in summer, with bottom heat
how_to_grow.pruning: Pruning group 12 in late winter or early spring
how_to_grow.pests: Glasshouse red spider mite, glasshouse whitefly and mealybugs may be troublesome
